string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns10111101101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.url: story_content/external_files/Working with Interpreters in the Classroom.pdf
resource.title: Working with Interpreters in the Classroom

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to Deaf Student Teaching Tips. If you are accessing this resource, you probably just learned you have a deaf student in your class. You may be asking yourself: “what changes do I need to make to my teaching in order to support this student?” Click Start to find specific strategies to support your student." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Learn how to modify your use of various teaching tools by clicking on the categories." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="HCC’s Assistive Technology Office provides additional tools to assist deaf students in their learning
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Smart Stethoscopes: Smart Stethoscopes allow a deaf student to see a heart beat.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Smart Microphones: Smart Microphones amplify a professor’s voice for a hard-of-hearing student
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Otter.AI: Otter.AI is a Smartphone app that will generate a transcript from class and then later correct it using AI." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Even if your student does not have a note-taker in their accommodation letter, directing students to take notes on Google Docs could provide additional support for that student." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="The closed captioning button on YouTube videos is not available when they are played within a Kahoot quiz. You can address this by opening the video in a separate window." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="If your student’s accommodation letter requires it, any media on your Canvas course will need to be captioned before the semester begins" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" /> <Span Text="Google Slides can display auto-captions while you are giving a live (not previously recorded) presentation. PowerPoint presentations with embedded audio can be professionally captioned if you provide them to Instructional Media in advance." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Auto-captioning is available for Google Slides, but it will not fulfill the 99% accuracy requirement included in some students’ accommodation letters." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="If you have a deaf student in your class, have students type their responses on VoiceThread rather than use audio or video." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Display Interpreter: You can support your deaf student on Zoom by making sure the interpreter or interpreters’ video is large enough on their screen.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Breakout Rooms: In addition to putting the interpreters in the same breakout room as your deaf student, you’ll need to enable multi-pinning for that student so that they can highlight their view of multiple interpreters.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Live Transcript: Not all deaf or hard of hearing students use interpreters. Some use captions. If your student’s accommodation letter allows for automatically generated captions - ones that are less than 99% accurate, using Zoom’s live transcript feature is an option.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Visual Accessibility: Accessibility for your deaf student on Zoom is not limited to interpreters or a live transcript; ensuring that others turn on their cameras and have good lighting will enable a deaf student to read facial cues that add to understanding.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Tips: When teaching via Zoom, you should follow the same interpreter norms that you would in person." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="If your student requires captions with 99% accuracy, request to have PowerPoints captioned by Instructional Media." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Mediasite is the platform HCC uses to host instructors’ videos. It enables your videos to be captioned by Instructional Media." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" /> <Span Text="Help the deaf student by highlighting the view of their interpreter(s) and the instructor." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="You can support deaf students during office hours or individual conferences by following these tips. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style Justification="Center" /> <Span Text="Service providers are individuals who provide assistance to students with disabilities in the classroom" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Your deaf student’s accommodation letter may specify that they require a note taker." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Interpreters: It is not uncommon for a student to be assigned two interpreters, depending on class length. Not all deaf students use an interpreter.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 1: Lip-reading is not equivalent to American Sign Language.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 2: Remember to look at and speak to the student rather than the interpreter.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 3: Unlike professional captions, auto-captions are often inaccurate and do not fulfill most accommodation letter requirements.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 4: Setting norms for group work can sometimes help to avoid certain issues between students." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Click to explore how to support deaf students in different class settings" /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Lecture: The Lecture module discusses supports for when you teach in a whole class format.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 1: Lag time is the amount of time it takes for an interpreter to translate speech into American Sign Language
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 2: Remember to look at and speak to the student rather than the interpreter.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 3: Remember to face the student when you speak.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 4: Starting a dialogue will enable the student to share their needs." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Group Work: The Group Work module discusses supports for when you split students into groups
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 1: Setting norms for group work can sometimes help to avoid certain issues between students.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 2: Other students may not have interacted with a deaf person prior to being in your class.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 3: Speaking while the deaf student is signing is equivalent to speaking over the deaf student.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 4: A semicircle will allow the deaf student to see everyone and the interpreter.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style LeadingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Plain" BulletChar="•" BulletFont="Arial"> <BulletPicture Size="0x0" /> </ListStyle> </Style> <Span Text="Tip 5: Starting a dialogue will enable the student to share their needs." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
